items.name: Bind - Queries resulted in authoritative answer
Bind - Queries which were dropped
items.description: Recursive queries for which the server discovered an excessive number of existing recursive queries for the same name, type and class and were subsequently dropped. This is the number of dropped queries due to the reason explained with the clients-per-query and max-clients-per-query options (see the description about clients-per-query.) This corresponds to the dropped counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Queries which were duplicates
items.description: Queries which the server attempted to recurse but discovered an existing query with the same IP address, port, query ID, name, type and class already being processed. This corresponds to the duplicate counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Other query failures
items.description: Other query failures. This corresponds to the failure counter of previous versions of BIND 9. Note: this counter is provided mainly for backward compatibility with the previous versions. Normally a more fine-grained counters such as AuthQryRej and RecQryRej that would also fall into this counter are provided, and so this counter would not be of much interest in practice.

items.name: Bind - Queries resulted in non authoritative answer
Bind - Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN
items.description: Queries resulted in NXDOMAIN. This corresponds to the nxdomain counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data
items.description: Queries resulted in NOERROR responses with no data. This corresponds to the nxrrset counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Queries which caused recursion
items.description: Queries which caused the server to perform recursion in order to find the final answer. This corresponds to the recursion counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Queries resulted in referral answer
items.description: Queries resulted in referral answer. This corresponds to the referral counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Queries resulted in a successful answer
items.description: Queries resulted in a successful answer. This means the query which returns a NOERROR response with at least one answer RR. This corresponds to the success counter of previous versions of BIND 9.

items.name: Bind - Requests with unsupported EDNS version received
Bind - Requests with invalid (TSIG or SIG(0)) signature
Bind - IPv4 requests received
items.description: IPv4 requests received. Note: this also counts non query requests.

items.name: Bind - IPv6 requests received
items.description: IPv6 requests received. Note: this also counts non query requests.

items.name: Bind - Dynamic updates rejected due to prerequisite failure
Bind Resolver - IPv4 NS address fetch failed
Bind Resolver - IPv4 NS address fetches invoked
Bind Resolver - IPv6 NS address fetch failed
Bind Resolver - IPv6 NS address fetches invoked
Bind Resolver - Mismatch responses received
items.description: Mismatch responses received. The DNS ID, response's source address, and/or the response's source port does not match what was expected. (The port must be 53 or as defined by the port option.) This may be an indication of a cache poisoning attempt.

items.name: Bind Resolver - Queries aborted due to quota control
Bind Resolver - Failures in opening query sockets
items.description: Failures in opening query sockets. One common reason for such failures is a failure of opening a new socket due to a limitation on file descriptors.

items.name: Bind Resolver - DNSSEC validation on negative information succeeded
Bind Socket - FDwatch Failures of binding sockets
Bind Socket - FDwatch Failures of connecting sockets
Bind Socket - FDwatch Connections established successfully
Bind Socket - FDwatch Errors in socket receive operations
Bind Socket - FDwatch Errors in socket send operations

Bind Socket - TCP4 Incoming connections successfully accepted
Bind Socket - TCP4 Failures of binding sockets

Bind Socket - UDP4 Connections established successfully
Bind Socket - UDP4 Failures of opening sockets
Bind Socket - UDP4 Sockets opened successfully

Bind Socket - UDP4 Errors in socket send operations

Bind Socket - UDP6 Failures of connecting sockets

Bind Socket - Unix Incoming connections successfully accepted
Bind Socket - Unix Failures of binding sockets
Bind Socket - Unix Failures of connecting sockets
Bind Socket - Unix Connections established successfully

Bind Zone Maintenance - IPv6 AXFR requested
